title: 111_hr4168
content: The Act titled "Algae-based Renewable Fuel Promotion Act of 2010" treats algae as a qualified feedstock for the cellulosic biofuel producer credit. The Act "Algae-based Renewable Fuel Promotion Act of 2010" includes amendments to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 regarding qualified feedstocks, specifically adding cultivated algae, cyanobacteria, or lemna as qualified feedstock for the cellulosic biofuel producer credit. The Act "Algae-based Renewable Fuel Promotion Act of 2010" amends the Internal Revenue Code to include cultivated algae, cyanobacteria, or lemna as qualified feedstock for the cellulosic biofuel producer credit. Special rules apply for fuel derived from these feedstocks sold for refining into fuel meeting specific requirements. The Act amends the Internal Revenue Code to include algae as a qualified feedstock for biofuel production, specifically second-generation biofuel. This change allows for bonus depreciation for biofuel plant property using algae as a feedstock. The Act includes algae as a qualified feedstock for second-generation biofuel production, allowing for bonus depreciation for biofuel plant property using algae. Amendments also replace "cellulosic" with "second generation" in various sections of the Internal Revenue Code. The Act allows for bonus depreciation for biofuel plant property using algae and replaces "cellulosic" with "second generation" in various sections of the Internal Revenue Code, effective for fuels sold or used after the enactment date. The Act allows for bonus depreciation for biofuel plant property using algae and replaces "cellulosic" with "second generation" in various sections of the Internal Revenue Code, effective for fuels sold or used after the enactment date. The provisions by subsection (c) shall apply to property placed in service after the date of the enactment of this Act. The Act ensures compliance with the Statutory Pay-As-You-Go Act of 2010 by referencing the budgetary effects of the Act as determined by the latest statement submitted by the Chairman of the House Budget Committee. Passed by the House of Representatives on September 28, 2010.
